Management

Let's review the important takeaways in this course.


Review

  1. PT (< 15-16 secs)
    • -If out of range high, correct with FFP
  2. PTT (60-90 secs)
    • -If out of range, correct with heparin changes
    • -Also consider ACT and Anti Xa levels
  3. Antifactor Xa (0.3-0.8)
    • -If out of range, correct with heparin changes
    • -Also consider ACT and PTT levels
  4. Antithromin III (80-100%)
    • -If out of range low, administer ATIII

Things to consider whenâ€¦

  1. Antifactor Xa is normal:
    • -PTT and ACT are low
      • Check/administer ATIII
        • -Can also give FFP
      • Increase heparin
    • -PTT and ACT are low
      • -PTT 60-90 seconds
      • -ATIII 80-120%
      • -Anti factor Xa 0.3-0.8 u/mL
      • -ACT 180-220 seconds
  1. Antifactor Xa is low:
    • -PTT and ACT are low
      • Increase heparin
      • Consider heparin bolus
    • -PTT and ACT are high
      • Increase heparin
      • Consider heparin bolus
      • Rule out DIC
      • Consider FFP
  1. Antifactor Xa is high:
    • -PTT and ACT are low
      • Check/administer ATIII
        • Can also give FFP
      • Decrease heparin
    • -PTT and ACT are high
      • Decrease heparin

You may want to print this downloadable resource for reference later - this is an important takeaway!
